result.execSummary:
The defendant Coreyon Marvelle D Greer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 2:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Coreyon M. Greer appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Coreyon M. Greer. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1; Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.  Court orders 9 months Rock County Jail, with full huber,  concurrent with 19CF837 and 20CM486, costs due to Clerk of Court, 3 days sentence credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 10, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Activity: Status conference

02:09 PM Defendant Coreyon M. Greer in court by video in custody with attorney Ryan W O'Hara in person.  David S Olson appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference on June 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Activity: Bail/Bond hearing  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:10 PM Defendant Coreyon Marvelle D Greer in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Kim Rau appeared by video. Victim A.F appeared by audio. Defense requests bond modification, State objects with argument. Court amends bond conditions: No violent or disorderly conduct with victim: A.F. Matter to be set.
No violent or disorderly conduct with victim: A.F.
